title: Synthetic Recap
body:
WASHINGTON (AP) — In an era defined by his high-flying artistry, Michael Jordan authored a masterpiece of pure, grinding will. On a night where offensive rhythm was a scarce commodity, Jordan delivered a historic 47-point performance to carry the Chicago Bulls to an 88-83 victory over the Washington Wizards.

The final score belies a contest that was a defensive slog, a game where points were precious. Yet Jordan, defying age and logic, was the one constant. He alone shouldered nearly 54 percent of the Bulls' entire offensive output, putting on a clinic in mid-range precision and relentless attack.

While his supporting cast struggled—Scottie Pippen the next highest scorer with just 10 points—Jordan was a force of nature. He was the entirety of the Bulls' offense, a one-man answer to every Wizards push. Washington, led by Juwan Howard's 22 points and Rod Strickland's 18, stayed within striking distance throughout, but they had no answer for number 23. Every time the Wizards threatened, Jordan had a response, a bucket to stem the tide and silence the capital crowd.

This was not the easy victory of a dynasty, but the hard-fought triumph of its singular king. In a game where 88 points were enough to win, Michael Jordan provided 47 of them, turning a potential team struggle into a personal tour de force and another unforgettable entry into his legendary canon.
